/**
 * The MessaggiErrore class contains static final String variables that represent different error messages that can occur in the application.
 * These error messages are used to provide meaningful feedback to the user when errors occur during the execution of the program.
 * 
 * The class does not contain any methods or constructors, as it is meant to be a simple container for error messages.
 * 
 * The error messages included in this class are:
 * - ERRORE_CONNESSIONE_DBMS: Represents an error related to a database connection.
 * - ERRORE_DBMS: Represents a generic database error.
 * - ERRORE_SCONOSCIUTO: Represents an unknown error.
 * - ERRORE_FORMATO_BEAN: Represents an error related to the format of a JavaBean.
 * - ERRORE_DATI: Represents an error related to data.
 * - ERRORE_FILE: Represents an error related to a file.
 * - ERRORE_NUM_BANNER: Represents an error related to the number of banners.
 * 
 * This class is intended to be used as a reference for error messages throughout the application, allowing for consistent error handling and messaging.
 */
